Glaciers are of considerable interest because of their high sensitivity to global warming
15 . Remote sensing images around August were selected to study the changes from 1987 to 2016. According to Fig. 3, the average altitude of snow line of Gangshika peak declined from 4342.2 to 4326.9 m during 1995–2005. However, from 2006–2016, the snow line was elevated from 4360.2 to 4385.3 m due to snow melting.
